intro: Ayapana squarrosa, commonly known as the hairy ayapana, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptic in shape and have a rough texture. Ayapana squarrosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
